intro: Diphryllum, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Diphylleaceae. It is characterized by its unique, often fleshy, and sometimes fragrant leaves that can be either simple or deeply lobed. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Diphryllum species are primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
